ygData.subject: Re: JBoots, Rubi & Beyond
ygData.msgSnippet: From what they say on the testserver, getting the jboots involve killing drelzna to get a note that says a thief has stolen them and then killing the lvl 40
ygData.messageBody:
From what they say on the testserver, getting the jboots involve killing
drelzna to get a note that says a thief has stolen them and then killing
the lvl 40 rogue and his two lvl 38 guards in rathe mountains.

Drokk, da majik trollie

"Jones, Brian" wrote:
>
> From: "Jones, Brian" <Brian.Jones@...>
>
> Yes but the ice comment quest should be difficult as it is for high level
> wizards (minus of the bugs of course, that isn't good). If they make the
> rubi quests like they did the crafted armor quest I think it will work out
> well. Make it necessary for high priced gems and a fairly accessible
> dropped item from multiple mobs and it will go well. The jboots should
> require a few rubies and maybe the feathers of a griffon.
>
> > ----------
> > From: Evgeny Ivanov[SMTP:evgeny@...]

> > >
> > > Keep reading the news, though. Instead of being dropped by a mob it is

> > > Hopefully they will make it so that only that class can do it and change
> > the
> > > warrior crafted quest where only warriors can do it.
> > >
> >
> > I am sure they will make that quests extremely buggy and insane difficult
> > to
> > complete as all later introducing quests. For example, quest for Ice Comet
> > was
> > buggy from beggining for several weeks, casters research quests was made
> > in such
> > manner so its more easy to train research in traditional way, quests for
> > Necro's
> > high level pet words are so hards so it is much more easy to find the
> > proper
> > words from regular high level mobs. Sure, it will be nightmare at Drelzna

> > in next 2 days :)
